title: Authors and Citation
text: Muecke M (2024). treasury: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper. R package version 0.0.1,  https://github.com/m-muecke/treasury, https://m-muecke.github.io/treasury.
code: @Manual{,   title = {treasury: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper},   author = {Maximilian Muecke},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1,  https://github.com/m-muecke/treasury},   url = {https://m-muecke.github.io/treasury}, }

title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: goal treasury provide simple modern interface US treasury XML feed daily interest rates. main difference packages ’s modern implementation using httr2 package. ## Installation can install development version treasury GitHub :

title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: treasury functions prefixed tr_ follow naming convention XML feed.
code: library(treasury)  yield_curve <- tr_yield_curve(2020) yield_curve #> # A tibble: 3,012 × 3 #>    date       maturity  rate #>    <date>     <chr>    <dbl> #>  1 2020-01-02 1 month   1.53 #>  2 2020-01-02 2 month   1.55 #>  3 2020-01-02 3 month   1.54 #>  4 2020-01-02 6 month   1.57 #>  5 2020-01-02 1 year    1.56 #>  6 2020-01-02 2 year    1.58 #>  7 2020-01-02 3 year    1.59 #>  8 2020-01-02 5 year    1.67 #>  9 2020-01-02 7 year    1.79 #> 10 2020-01-02 10 year   1.88 #> # ℹ 3,002 more rows  library(ggplot2)  subset(yield_curve, maturity == "10 year") |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = rate)) +   geom_line()

title: US Treasury XML Feed Wrapper
text: ustyc - R package download parse US Treasury yield curve data
